Functions

Function(s) admin.get_index_name.
Return the the index name(s) corresponding to the schema,table and column list. Possible further index definitions, e.g.: for partial indexes, are not considered. Included columns must be listed in the columns too. Example: select * from admin.get_index_name('oms','OrderDO','{shopOrderNo,shopRef}'; -- with include columns:...(id) INCLUDE ("shopOrderNo", "shopRef") select * from admin.get_index_name('oms','OrderDO','{shopOrderNo,shopRef,id}'); Can be used to avoid duplicate index definitions under different names Example: IF NOT EXISTS (select * from admin.get_index_name('oms','OrderDO','{shopOrderNo,shopRef}')) THEN CREATE INDEX idx_name on oms."OrderDO" ("shopOrderNo","shopRef"); END IF;

FUNCTION admin.get_index_name ( schemaname text, tablename text, columns text[] ) RETURNS setof text LANGUAGE 'plpgsql' volatile;
